newsitem.title: UK: Merrill Lynch Europe posts 70.9 mln stg H1 profit.
newsitem.headline: Merrill Lynch Europe posts 70.9 mln stg H1 profit.

text.p: Merrill Lynch Europe Plc, part of the Merrill Lynch & Co Inc, on Friday said it posted a first-half pre-tax profit of 70.9 million stg compared with a 7.0 million stg loss a year earlier.

Merrill said the group had benefited "from strong performances across all of its main businesses", adding that the results also reflected the results of the international equities business acquired as part of Smith New Court in August 1995.
"This business is now fully and successfully integrated into the group," Merrill said in a statement.
Merrill said fully diluted earnings per share for the European group were 9.2 pence for the first half.
During the first half Merrill Lynch Europe had issued 157 million shares to its parent company for a consideration of 270 million stg, used to finance the expansion of operations.

Merrill said operating revenue for the period was 436.9 million stg, compared with 161.6 million in the first half of 1995. Operating costs were 366 million stg compared with 168.6 million in the same period a year earlier.
